newsitem.title: FINLAND: Nokia and Elektrobit set joint venture.
newsitem.headline: Nokia and Elektrobit set joint venture.

text.p: Finnish telecommunications group Nokia Oy said in a statement on Thursday it had established a cellular network measurement tool joint venture with Finnish research and development company Elektrobit Oy.
"The two companies have had cooperation for many years and the joint venture is a logical step to reinforce this existing cooperation," Nokia said.
The joint venture, called Nemo Technologies Oy will produce products such as cellular air interface monitors, quality of service testers and autonomous measuring equipment, Nokia said.
The products can be used for cellular network monitoring and performance optimisation, it said.
Elektrobit has about 90 employees and its net sales last year were about 90 million markka, Nokia said.
It did not state its investment in the new company.
